elements: Clovette is happy in way that brooks no counter-argument to happiness. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]

Dorothy is an enthusiastic sort with an eclectic reading habit. She's fascinated by your hints about the shapes beneath the world's skin. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Enid speaks softly, and sometimes her gaze doesn't focus on anything visible. It may be that you've dreamed the same dreams. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Rose is a sly miss, and she recognises you as someone uncommon. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Leo is an earnest sort with an interest in the occult. He hangs on your hints about the invisible arts. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Neville pauses before he speaks, and flinches easily. He laughs whenever he thinks you've made a joke. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Tristan dislikes distractions. Tristan gets things done. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Victor is a sly fellow, and he knows an unusual opportunity when he sees it. [You might be able to recruit this acquaintance as a follower.]
Clovette's determined happiness now borders on the fanatical.
Dorothy is an enthusiastic sort, and I have turned her enthusiasm to our advantage.
Enid speaks softly, and sometimes her gaze doesn't focus on anything visible. She sees things that others don't.
Rose is a sly miss, but loyal.
Leo is an earnest sort, but he's prepared to do what he must.
Neville pauses before he speaks, and flinches easily. He's sensitive to deeper matters.
Tristan dislikes distractions; Tristan likes results.
Victor is a sly fellow, but loyal.
